question: In an LCR series circuit, the value of only capacitance C is varied. The resulting variation of resonance frequency f₀ as a function of C can be represented as
images/d4e5f6a1-b2c3-4d4e-1f2a-345678901234.png
explanation: Resonance frequency is given by f₀ = 1 / (2π√(LC)).
This implies f₀ is proportional to 1/√C.
The graph of f₀ versus C is a curve that decreases as C increases (rectangular hyperbola shape), which corresponds to Graph C.
